intro: Lipochaeta connata, commonly known as the narrowleaf goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its small, yellow flowers are followed by bracts that resemble leaves, giving it a distinctive appearance. Lipochaeta connata is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in full sun.
